[/quote]
News = hyped-up media.[/quote]

item.title: Near-Earth asteroid
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“sp11k3t3ht3rd, post:20, topic:400910”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=497964.msg3641802#msg3641802 date=1309053955]

Now is the astroid ten meters or ten miles? 10 miles could do some damage, but 10 meters? Not likely. Even if it made it’s way to earth, the result wouldn’t be very catastrophic.

Imagine an object 10 meters in diameter flying toward our atmosphere at 5,000 miles and hour and gaining speed due to the fact that nothing can slow it down, and would gain speed entering our atmosphere. Now imagine it slamming into our planet. The shock wave would be catastrophic.
[/quote]

Friction? and at ten meters wide it would probably burn up to at least half its size.[/quote]AND break up from the force.

tour bus sized rock flying at us? nbd.

Read full topic

item.title: Near-Earth asteroid
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“Jerico Pimpinbro, post:14, topic:400910”][quote author=Marine5287 link=topic=497964.msg3641683#msg3641683 date=1309045469]

I wish it was gonna actually hit the Earth.

If it did, most/all lifeforms on the planet would go extinct. Basically the same effect as what happened to the dinosaurs. I doubt you wish even the slightest that that would actually happen.

How would that happen if it’s only the size of a tour bus?
[/quote]

It would still throw up some dirt that could potentially kill a few things, and a few things killed off kills even more and it can go onto an endless chain like that.[/quote]
Except ecosystems aren’t global. If all of the animals in Europe die, North and South America will do fine.

Read full topic
